fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA REST API has these two similar methods (in [this documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-getUser]):
# GET on api/2/user (return information about a user)
# GET on api/2/user/search (information on one of more users)

When using operation 2 for a user, it intermittently fails. Though we have a 200 success return, an empty set of data is returned, though the user has data and operation 1 returns correctly.

This is consistently failing for some users and consistently working for others.

h3. Environment
* Only tested in JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a clean JIRA Cloud instance
# Create a user:
#* Username: test
# Make sure it belongs exactly to: ‘confluence-users’ and ‘jira-software-users’
#* We were able to replicate it this way and since it’s not happening to all users, group membership may play a role
# Run this (replacing user, password and instance accordingly, 'otheruser' must have access to the users)
{noformat}
curl -D- -u otheruser:password -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://myinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=test
{noformat}
# Run this (there's a /search' in this one):
{noformat}
curl -D- -u otheruser:password -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://myinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user/search?username=test
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Both return a 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK' and user information.

h3. Actual Results
Both return a 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK', showing the operation is accepted, the first operation shows the data from the user, but the second returns no data (returns ‘[ ]’).
 
h3. Notes
TestLink uses ‘/rest/api/2/user/search’ and may fail because of that, if the user selected is affected.

If you have access to TestLink code, we’ve been able to fix it removing the ‘/search’ from the call.

Just changed the file "/var/www/testlink/third_party/fayp-jira-rest/Jira.php", public function "getUser":
 - From: $this->request->openConnect($this->host . 'user/search/?username=' . $username, 'GET');
 - To: $this->request->openConnect($this->host . 'user?username=' . $username, 'GET');

h3.Workaround
If you’re searching data for one user, use ‘/rest/api/2/user’ instead.
fields.summary: The REST API operation GET on '/user/search' is not working consistently

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Change the link in JIRA's Look and Feel to anything but the default blue.
# Mark at least two dashboards as favourites so the left column with the list of favourites shows.

!dashboard.png!

The list of favourites will remain as the default blue link colour, regardless of what the Link & Feel page says. Hitting the "Refresh Client Resources" link doesn't help.
fields.summary: Dashboard list link colours don't respect Look & Feel colours

fields.description:
h3. Original Summary
On Safari 8.0.5, we noticed that JIRA Insiders popup appeared a couple days ago. Now, it doesn't disappear and blocks important JIRA scrum button and upper-right screen real estate.

Please disable this popup or have some way to close it.

h3. Cause

This is caused by the uBlock / AdBlock extensions. A default install does not reproduce this. 

Only once the 'fanboy-annoyance' block list is enabled this becomes an issue. It's quite liberal in what it blocks and seems to remove any UI elements (including forms) with the text 'newsletter' in them. That has the effect of also removing the close link from this popup.

h3. Workaround

You can temporarily disable the _fanboy annoyances_ list in either uBlock or Safari AdBlock (or the entire add-on if you'd prefer) to make the 'No thanks' button appear which will allow you to close the dialog.
fields.summary: Popup Advert for Jira Insider stays up, blocks key buttons in upper-right corner when uBlock or AdBlock browser extensions are installed

fields.description:
h2.Summary
Attachments are not attached if the attachment field is added into the screen for 'Close' status transition.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Add a screen to the close status issue transition.
# Add the attachment to the screen.
# Attempt to close the ticket and add attachment.

h2.Expected result
Ticket is closed with attachment attached.

h2.Current result
Ticket is closed but attachment is not attached. Error is shown in logs.

{noformat}
2015-09-24 10:20:20.318051500 2015-09-24 10:20:20,317 ajp-nio-127.0.0.104-8009-exec-77 WARN sysadmin 620x29593x1 1x0qk5x 103.233.242.8,104.192.140.226 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.j.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField] There were errors while converting temporary attachments: AttachmentError{logMessage='An error occurred: You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', localizedMessage='You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', filename='', reason=VALIDATION_FAILED, exception=none()}
{noformat}

According to user, files can be attached on issue closure but now this is not possible because the issue is closed (causing it not to be editable) and preventing the attachment to be added.

h2.Workaround
Attach the file before closing the ticket.
fields.summary: Attachment field in 'Close' status transition screen returns error and fail to attach file

fields.description:
Atlassian Cloud has a default 'POP Mail Server' and a default Mail Handler called 'Comments from emails' (Studio Email Handler). They can be edited or deleted but changes will be restored automatically after a JIRA restart.

*Problem:*
When setting a Mail Handler to use the same 'POP Mail Server' with email address jira@instancename.atlassian.net both Handlers (default and new) will compete to get emails at different times and not all emails will result in an issue created or comment added by the Handlers.

*Details:*
The default Mail Handler 'Comments from emails' looks for emails on a different moment that the other Mail handlers (see the times):
{noformat}
# cat * | grep "MailFetcherService"
2014-09-30 15:46:15,211 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:46:30,462 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:47:15,211 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:47:30,485 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:48:15,212 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:48:30,461 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:49:15,210 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called
2014-09-30 15:49:30,462 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] MailFetcherService run() method has been called{noformat}

So depending on when the email is received, it can be grabbed by one mail handler or the other and it will be deleted after is processed. In this example we see several emails being deleted by different handlers:
{noformat}
# cat * | grep "Closing store" -B1 | grep deleted
2014-09-30 14:19:15,912 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
2014-09-30 14:27:15,717 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
2014-09-30 14:34:15,745 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
2014-09-30 14:46:30,695 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
2014-09-30 15:02:30,673 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
2014-09-30 15:03:15,659 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    MAP handler [com.atlassian.mail.incoming] S: +OK Logging out, messages deleted.
{noformat}

*Scenarios:*
A) If emails subject have an Issue Key and are from a JIRA user, then a comment will always be added.
B) If emails subject have an Issue Key and are NOT from a JIRA user, then a comment is only added if the New Handler processes the email.
C) If emails subject don't have an Issue key, then an Issue is created only if the New Handler processes the email.

So what happens in (B) is that the default mail handler 'Comments from emails' may remove the email because there is no action to do (because the user is not a valid JIRA user and there is no Default Reporter set). Then afterwards the 'MAP handler' finds an empty email box and the email was lost.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a Mail Handler with:
*- Server: 'POP Mail Server'
*- Handler:  'Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue' on a project.
*- Default Reporter: any user with create issue, add comment and add attachment permissions to the project selected.
# enable "The Incoming Mail debug log" from <instance>/secure/admin/ViewLogging.jspa
# send messages at different times while tailing the logs with "grep deleted" to see the different mail handlers responding to the emails

*Workaround:*
Set a different Server with a different email address and use that server on new Mail Handlers (and if used in multiple handlers, set the 'Catch Email Address' on all of them to avoid the same situation)
Additionaly, the Project Email Address can be changed to match the POP Server address in the Project Administration/Notifications section
fields.summary: Using Atlassian Cloud default POP mail Server on another Mail Handler has undesired effects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA still sends notification emails to users whose application access to JIRA has been removed but are still active users.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a JIRA project using the default permission and notification schemes.
 # Create a user, "Alice", and grant her JIRA application access (Core or Software, doesn't matter which).
 # Create a new issue in the new project and assign it to Alice.
 # Add a comment to the ticket and see that an email is sent to Alice as expected.
 # Remove all application access from Alice then add another comment to the ticket.
h3. Expected results

No notifications are sent to Alice.
h3. Actual results

A notification of the comment in step 5 is sent to Alice.
h3. Workaround

Fully deactivate the user from User Management instead of just removing application access.
fields.summary: When removing application access email notifications should stop

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to edit or add a new Mail server throws a 500 error

h3. Environment
This Affects JIRA Cloud only as only in Cloud will the default Mail server be put back after a restart of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a JIRA Admin, go to Incoming Mail.
# Delete the default 'Pop Mail Server'
# Add a new mail server with the same name 'POP Mail Server'
# The next time JIRA restarts JIRA Cloud will put the default mail server back
# Now there are two mail servers with the same name
# Try to update the mail server you added in step 3. Either by saving it, or by Testing the connection

h3. Expected Results
The save or connection test is successful

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the Browser as well in the default JIRA log.

fields.description:
- Administration > Issues > Issue Security Schemes > Security Levels
- Add Security Level form is displayed at the bottom of the page
- In the Name field enter Security Level name that contains apostrophe, ie. "Customer's Representatives"
- Go to a project to which above Issue Security Scheme is applied
- Try to assign Security Level to an Issue, "Customer's Representatives" IS NOT available in the drop-down list


- Administration > Issues > Issue Security Schemes > Security Levels
- Rename "Customer's Representatives" to "Customer Representatives"
- Go to a project to which above Issue Security Scheme is applied
- "Customer Representatives" IS available in the drop-down list
fields.summary: If Issue Security Level name contains apostrophe, it cannot be assigned to an Issue

fields.description:
The same bug which got fixed before: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35448

- Go to User Preferences (.../secure/admin/ViewUserDefaultSettings.jspa):
- See that Default outgoing email format	 is *HTML*
- Create a new user, login by that user, go user profile page of that user, see the Email type = *HTML* ---> *Change it to text* (we have to change the value here, if not, it will going to be the same as Default outgoing email format	in User Preferences without *Apply* action)
- Go back to User Preferences (login as an admin), change Default outgoing email format	 to *text* ---> Click Apply, it says that at least there is 1 user would be affected.
- Go to the user profile page of the user ---> it still keeps the old value (HTML), but it receives notification in JIRA in text.
- Go back to User Preferences (login as an admin), still keep the Outgoing email = *text* ---> Click Apply, it says that at least there is 0 user would be affected.

So, I suspect that, the value is really changed, but it doesn't display correctly.
fields.summary: Outgoing email type in user profile does not reflect the change from User Preferences Default outgoing email format.

fields.description:
Documentation [*Managing Users*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Managing+Users] makes users think that users with JIRA Administration Global Permissions can also Manage Users.

{quote}Log in as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission.
Choose  > User Management. {quote}

Though, this permission is granted to users that belong to *site-admins* group as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Manage+groups].

Please update the documentation to make it more clear to users which permissions they need to have in order to Manage Users.

This issue is relevant to the Cloud version of JIRA.

h3. Summary
If you click on a label from the issue view screen you are redirected a JQL query applied to the issue navigator search noting {{labels = <the_label_selected>}}  if the same action is performed from the Issue navigator *List View* with the *labels* column added to the search set you are redirected to a blank JQL displaying all issues with no filter applied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Issue navigator
# Switch to List View
# Add the *Labels* Column 
# Click on ay label in the column

h3. Expected Results
New JQL search is displayed returning the results matching the label selected

Exe: If the label {{Test}} is selected the Following JQL is applied to issue navigator
 - {{labels = Test}}

h3. Actual Results
- Current Filter result is cleared
- returns a blank search containing all issues


h3.Workaround
Use list View To narrow down search results 
Manually add {{labels = <Desired_Label>}} to the advanced filter JQL

fields.description:
I noticed today that the JIRA Classic project template appears to have disappeared from some Atlassian Cloud instances of JIRA.  Hopefully this is just an oversight and it will be reinstated soon.

If the case is that this move was deliberate, then I am opposed to its removal.  Managing JIRA as an administrator, especially at the enterprise level, is complicated by the number of schemes in the JIRA instance.  Having separate workflows, issue type schemes, issue type screen schemes, screen schemes, and screens for every single JIRA project is unmanageable when dealing with a large number of projects.  This is why I have always used the JIRA Classic/Default template since the introduction of Project Templates, as it creates no new schemes.  For a responsible JIRA administrator, applying the correct schemes is significantly less work than replacing and deleting unwanted schemes.
fields.summary: Project Type - Default Classic Project Type Missing

fields.description:
Since the changes to address JRA-19873, attachments taken from one JIRA Cloud instance can't be imported into another one.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Ensure your JIRA 7.0.0-OD-02 instance has some files attached to issues.
# Run a backup from the Backup Manager with "Backup additional files (including attachments, avatars and logos)" ticked.
# Download the backup and [split it up into its separate JIRA XML and attachments directories in preparation for import back into Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Restoring+a+JIRA+Cloud+Backup+into+a+JIRA+Cloud+instance].
# Attempt to re-import the backup into another Cloud instance.

h3. Expected results
The import runs successfully.

h3. Actual results
The XML is imported fine, but JIRA fails on attachments with the following error in the logs:

{code:none}
Attachments should be placed in structure attachments/[PROJECT_KEY]/[ISSUE_KEY]/[ID] but was 'attachments/PROJECT/10000/PROJECT-601/19140'
{code}

h3. Workaround
Manually move all the issue directories ("PROJECT-1", "PROJECT-2", etc.) in each bucket ("10000", "20000", etc.) directly into the root level of their respective project directory, re-zip the attachments directory, then run the import again.
fields.summary: Unable to import backup generated with JIRA 7.0.0-OD-02+ into another 7.0.0-OD-02+ instance

fields.description:
In the past week we've seen multiple instances completely unresponsive. When examining the instances further it shows that according to memory usage graphs they're reporting ~800MB of memory used. 
However they aren't actually given that much heap to begin with. When restarted they will indicate their heap is 512MB, but the instance will soon climb to 800 once again, becoming slow and eventually no longer responding to requests.

*Workaround*
Create a heapdump of the application that's using too much memory.
Provide a higher heap than the instance is using.
fields.summary: Several instances using more memory than heap exists, but do not cause OOME

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Attempting to delete an issue with expandable attachment (e.g. zip file) cause deleting thread to deadlock. Other issues are not affected.
UPDATE: some issues with other attachments are also affected.

h3. Workaround

When such issue is identified there is possible workaround by removing attachments from the affected issue and then removing issue.
But before doing that the deadlocked connections to database need to be terminated - as they block any changes on the affected issue. This can be done by executing pg_terminate_backend on database or by restarting the application.

It would not be easy to identify which are the issues that contain attachments when you are trying to delete a huge number of issues. A much simpler way to work this around is to create a temporary project that have the browse project permission restricted to only administrator and then move those issues into that project to keep it out of sight. You can then delete the whole project when the fix is released.

h3. Technical details

The problem is that DefaultAttachmentManager#deleteAttachment calls attachmentStore.deleteAttachment which spawns new thread. When the thread processing is done then callback is executed in that new thread - and callback code executes attachmentIndexManager.removeAttachmentIndex which deletes DB entries (outside the main transaction(!)) that were already modified (in main transaction(!)) before the DefaultAttachmentManager#deleteAttachment call. 

Due to that we have deadlock:
* Request thread waits (on .claim()) for background thread
* Background thread waits for response from DB (it tries to remove row in DB)
* DB is waiting for main transaction to finish (as this block the query done by background thread)

This issue does affect Cloud instances only (in BTF other code is used that doesn't spawn new thread).
fields.summary: Cannot remove issue that contains attachment (JIRA Cloud only)

fields.description:
I've created a number of users over the last few weeks in JIRA On Demand.  This morning when I tried to create a new user I was only given the option to enter an email address, check if they have JIRA access, and modify the email options (days until invitation expires).  At the top it said "Fill in the information below to create new users. We'll email your teammates instructions for logging in."  I want to be able to specify the username, not let JIRA give me a generated username (like u30).  I have both administrators and site-admins groups assigned to my ID.  

I just looked at some screenshots I'd done a couple weeks ago.  There were three buttons, "Create user", "Invite users", and "Google Apps".  The "Create user" button took me to https://<company>.atlassian.net/admin/users/add, as it does now, but it had the Username, Name, Email address, and Password fields.  Now I only have two buttons, "Create user" and "Google Apps", and the "Create user" button is behaving like "Invite users" used to.

Michael Keller, https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/users?username=team5, has indicated that he's also experiencing the issue (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10412087).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please close : "Create user" is behaving like "Invite users" - need to specify username (dupe of AOD-7576)

  (anonymous function)
  dispatch
  i
{code}

h2.Workaround
Right Click (Gesture two finger click or Ctrl Click) select paste
OR
Select Edit paste
OR
Spam command+v and the past will eventually start working after 20 - 30 attempts Delete extra text (Just hold it down till it works)

fields.description:
*Summary:*
There is currently an issue where it is not possible for Chilean customers to log work via Tempo. Due to outdated timezone data on the system; attempting to log work with Tempo will result in an error page.
!Screen Shot 2015-05-12 at 10.06.03 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to Replicate:*
Just grab a Chilean instance and try logging work via Tempo.

*Expected Result:*
Working hours logged.

*Current Result:*
Error page shows when attempting to log work.

*Notes:*

fields.summary: Timezone in Chile causing Tempo to fail

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce

# As an admin, create an issue security level with "Group (Anyone)".
# As an admin, remember to grant Browse Project permission to "Group (Anyone)", too.
# As an authenticated user (or admin), create an issue with issue security level created in step 1.
# As an anonymous user, search for the issue created in step 3. Note that as an anonymous user I can still visit directly to the ticket given the URL.

h4. Expected Results:

# As an anonymous user, I am be able to search for the issue via issue navigator.

h4. Actual Results:

# As an anonymous user, I am not able to search for the issue via issue navigator.

h4. Workaround:

As the original intention is to make the issues anonymously viewable, remove the issue security level from those issues. Any other issues can still be given an issue security level to restrict from public viewing.
fields.summary: Cannot search anonymously for issue that has issue security level given to Anyone

h3. Summary
When editing an issue within JIRA and choosing a Due Date using the calendar picker, the user gets the error {{The Jira calendar doesn't currently support your language}}. Users experiencing this have their language set to English (US). It happens for all the users in the instance, and regardless of what browser or OS they are using.

# Click *Edit* on any issue
# Select a *Due Date* using the calendar picker
# Click *Update*. It returns the error "The Jira calendar doesn't currently support your language"

The issue would be updated with the desired Due Date.

h3. Actual Results
The error {{The Jira calendar doesn't currently support your language}} is thrown and the changes are not saved.

h3.Workaround
Check your user profile settings and make sure the language is not -1 (see screenshot).

fields.description:
With Filter gadgets and two dimensional filter gadgets on the dashboard, using smaller fonts or resizing the board can cause large gaps between gadgets and separating lines in columns to disappear or be unrendered.

Fix should be applied to the "Edit layout" button, in order to trigger individual resize events for all gadgets present in the dashboard.

Given the performance impacts of efficiently detecting changes in browser zoom or window resize, the workaround for these situations is a manual reload.

fields.description:
There are a few different kinds of user autocomplete fields:
# User dropdown list
# User text field
# User text area

There is odd behavior on the Create Issue modal dialog for some of these types of fields. I'll go down the line on the different autocomplete fields.

For the user dropdown list, there is no issue. Typing a name and hitting enter when the name is highlighted will fill in that name and the dropdown will go away.

For the user text field:
# Start typing a known name
# When the autocomplete dropdown appears, arrow to the right name and hit enter
What's expected:
Username is auto filled in the field and the autocomplete menu goes away
What happens:
Username is auto filled but the enter triggers a save on the modal dialog and the issue gets created despite likely not being done writing the ticket. 
Also, if you click on the autofilled name instead of hitting enter, the autocomplete menu doesn't go away until you click on something else or tab out.

For the user text area:
# Start typing a known name
# When the autocomplete dropdown appears, arrow to the right name and hit enter
What's expected:
Username is autofilled in the field and the autocomplete menu goes away. Cursor returns to the field next to where the name was autofilled.
What happens:
Username is autofilled in the field but a carriage return is added after the name, with the autocomplete name still present. Cursor is at the new line.
Also, if you click on the name instead of hitting enter, the autocomplete menu is still present until you click away or tab out.

This only started happening maybe a month ago? It works fine if you use the Edit Issue dialog.
fields.summary: Autocomplete on user fields for new issues not properly handled

fields.description:
Here are the things that the documentation does wrong:

* It does not state that you must provide only one of issueKey or projectKey.
* It claims that the username filter can be empty but that does not currently work. This is probably a bug rather than a documentation issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43081
* The username field does not specify wether it works on usernames or userkeys. You should be able to provide keys instead of names. 
* It gives no documentation on what to expect when an anonymous user hits the resource.
* It gives no documentation on what HTTP result codes to expect for a user that lacks the required permissions.

In short this resource is quite complicated and could use much more information around the permissions that are required, the fields that are required and what to expect in the error scenarios.
fields.summary: The documentation for rest/api/2/user/permission/search is confusing or wrong.

fields.description:
JIRA brings users to login page when accessing issue link from Excel (and also word docs) even after logged in. Users have the permission to view the issue.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Login to JIRA
# Export JIRA issues into Excel sheet
# Open the Excel sheet and double click on issue key(hyperlink)
# Make sure that the link is open in the same browser which has the login session
# JIRA will redirect user to https://<JIRA.domain>/login?dest-url=%2Fbrowse%2FABC-123&permission-violation=true

h4.Note
It seems that this bug is also affecting word document; not only Excel sheets.


PS : I am not able to reproduce this issue in JIRA 7.
fields.summary: JIRA bring users to login page when accessing issue link from Excel even after logged in

fields.description:
h4.  Symptoms

* User cannot transition an issue, if the transition contains a webhooks post function. Error message: {code}Could not load FunctionProvider class{code}
* Administrators see blank page when visiting Webhook administration page
* Administrators cannot see Webhook administration page

h1.Additional Note On FIX:
- In some cases this requires an additional restart of the JIRA service to restart the plugin appropriately

If you are still experiencing this Please file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com requesting a restart to JIRA with a time and date to apply the maintenance.  And please reference this bug in your case.
* The restart should take no more than 25m, if no unexpected problems occur.
fields.summary: Webhooks missing after weekly maintenance update 20150504

fields.description:
This will occur on any comment or change history search where the number of results is small (for instance, searching on issues changed on a specific day or only after the start of today) and the instance has a large number of issues.

There's currently no workaround, other than temporarily a query that returns a larger set of issues (using {{startOfWeek()}} instead of {{startOfDay()}} for instance.
fields.summary: Search may not return all results if number of results is small and index size is large

fields.description:
The JIRA Cloud Backup Manager is currently throwing the following error when attachments are missing for OnDemand:

In the UI:

{quote}
Woah! Something went wrong!
Unexpected error during export has occurred
{quote}

The UI also shows red text on a red background, which needs to be fixed.

In the logs:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ABC/ABC-123/10000 (No such file or directory)
{noformat}

Missing attachments is undesirable, but it can happen if the attachments weren't imported for example. It should throw a warning, not an error.

*Workaround*

Create a backup without attachments, and then log a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com and ask the Support Engineer to provide you with a zip of your attachment directory.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Backup Manager throwing attachment missing error

fields.description:
* Open the "Options" menu (by clicking on the (▼)
* Click the "Show all" item, there will be a small black circle in front of it, OK
* Now, click on the "Show Open" item, the small black circle will be placed on this item which is OK but ... it's a fake status
* Reload the page, open the "Options" menu again, now, we will see there small black circles placed on three last menu items
fields.summary: Issue detail - subtask - selected item in "Options" menu is incorrectly marked

fields.description:
The attachment folder in the Jira backups zip file are not displayed in windows, even though the files are present (and visible in linux)

*to replicate:*
# Go to Backup manager
# Create a Jira backup with including attachments 
# Download the Jira backup to windows
# In windows open the Jira backup or extract the Jira backup

result:  the attachment folder is not present

*confirm the Jira backup* 
#  Download the Jira backup to linux/mac 
#  unzip the Jira backup

result:  the attachment folder is present

*work around*
use a different unzip application (eg. winrar, 7-Zip)

!Windows 7 [Running] 2014-09-23 14-40-34 2014-09-23 14-40-52.jpg!
!Windows 7 [Running] 2014-09-23 14-41-34 2014-09-23 14-41-59.jpg!
!zaansmeisje.png!
fields.summary: The attachment folders in the Jira Backup are not displayed in windows

fields.description:
Tested on Windows 8, 8.1, 7 with firefox 35.0.1, IE

h3.Reproduce:
- open add a comment field to an issue
- pasting content into the comment field

h3.Expected
- text is pasted in and cursor is visible to identify location for editing pasted content

h3.Actual:
- the cursor disappears but can continue to type.
- in IE11, the cursor disappears, but clicking in the box causes it to reappear


h3.Workaround:
hit esc. and click back into comment text field and cursor will return
fields.summary: Firefox and IE on Windows has curser to disappears when pasting comment

fields.description:
A disabled user (an user without application access to JIRA) can be chosen as the reporter of an existing issue, simply by editing the reporter and choosing the disabled user.

Disabled users shouldn't be able to be set as issue reporters, since they cannot create issues themselves.

*Steps to replicate*
# Disable a user (revoking all application access and removing it from all groups)
# Create a test issue with another user
# Start editing the issues reporter

*Expected behavior*
# The disabled user is not even in the users dropdown list to be selected as the reporter

*Actual behavior*
# User is in the list
# User can be chosen and can be set as reporter
fields.summary: Disabled user can be set a reporter

fields.description:
I added a post function to a workflow transition to change the Priority field of an issue to High. This results in the following description in the list of post functions:

{quote}Type: class
Class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction
Arguments:
field.name = priority
full.module.key = com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.workflowupdate-issue-field-function
field.value = 10000{quote}

However, if I add a condition to only allow certain users in a group to execute the transition, the description changes to this (where 'ABC' is the group I selected in the condition):

{quote}Only users in group ABC can execute this transition.{quote}

Removing the condition reverts the description.
fields.summary: List of post functions for workflow transition shows wrong description
"Description" title missing in non-US English notifications

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
'W' shortcut is currently associated to three actions as listed below,
- Log work on issue
- Log work with Tempo
- Watch/Unwatch Issue

There are conflicts with this shortcut as follow
||Location||Expected Behaviour||Current Behaviour||
|Global Shortcuts|!global.png!|Opens Tempo Log Work(/)|
|Issue Action|!issue.png!|Watch/Unwatch Issue(/)|
|Navigating Issue|!navigating_agile.png!|# If viewed in list mode, does nothing(x)
# If viewed in detail view, Watch/Unwatch Issue(x)|
|Agile Shortcuts|!navigating_agile.png!|Opens Tempo Log Work(x)|

Apart from these contradictions, the previously available shortcut to log work in issue view is no longer available. Pressing '.' and finding log work still works. If this is an expected behavior the Keyboard Shortcut (Help > Keyboard Shortcut) may need an update.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut Conflict between Log work (Tempo) and Watch Issue

fields.description:
According the documentation:
* [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-Watcher]

The *Watcher* field should have support for the auto-complete feature and behave the same way as the *Assignee* feature for example, but the auto-complete do not happens as we start to type in Usernames.
The auto-complete only displays "currentuser()" and not a list of available users.

Here's an example that states the described behaviour when the auto-complete do not kick in:
!WatcherField.png|thumbnail!
Here's another, for the *Assignee*, of when it works:
!Assignee.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Watcher System Field does not support auto-complete

fields.description:
The problem here is that if you create a link for an application which can not be directly accessed from JIRA, the application link page becomes inaccessible.

We have an application which is currently firewalled off from the outside world, but DOES have a real URL for internal use. We want the application to call out to JIRA using OAUTH which means we have to create an application link. Our integration is expected to be one way (our app calling JIRA).

Problem is, the application link form requires a URL. If you enter the real URL of an app that JIRA can not access (dropped packets, not rejected). The application links page becomes unusable. It appears the page is attempting to connect to each application listed (not sure why). Eventually there is a timeout and an error is displayed. Problem is, the existing application links ARE NOT SHOWN. This means you can't even delete or change the offending link.

I was eventually able to get in and delete the link, but it took a very long time. As a fix, I had to create the link with a dummy url so the page would fail immediately and not time out.
fields.summary: Application Link Page Hangs if Application endpoint inaccessible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Updates in JIRA issues don't show Workbox notifications in Confluence.
Comments, mentions, shares from JIRA are not being displayed in Confluence Workbox. 
*Note:* Mentions, shares, etc from Confluence are displayed correctly in the Workbox.

h3. Environment
Confluence & JIRA Application links

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On an affected site:
# Leave a comment with an @ mention to a user
# Open the Workbox with that user in Confluence
*Expected:* Comment is displayed
*Actual:* Workbox is empty 

No error in the JIRA or Confluence logs
 
h3. Cause:
JIRA mywork-common-plugin sometimes fails to get the Confluence application ID and fails to send the notification.

h3.Workaround
Most of the times a JIRA restart temporarily solves the problem but it reappears afterwards.
fields.summary: Confluence Workbox is not displaying updates from JIRA

fields.description:
Created vs Resolved chart now consider *createdDate* to calculate for resolved issues. By using *createdDate*, the chart won't plot issues which created outside from the period(Days Previously) and resolved within the period. It will only have issues that are *created and resolved* within the set period of time.

h4. Previous behavior
The chart uses *resolutionDate* to chart for resolved issues count. Therefore, it will still shows for issues created outside the set period of time.

h4. Note
The chart will still show data based on previous behavior in *Wallboard* mode.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved chart now consider createdDate to calculate for resolved issues

fields.description:
When creating multiple issues with the 'Create another' check box checked, some fields have their values preserved from the previous issue created, e.g. Component/s, Due Date, Assignee; however, the Sprint field doesn't keep the previous selection.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create one issue selecting a sprint on the Sprint field and check the 'Create another' check box.
- Notice that the previous Sprint selected isn't preserved.
fields.summary: Create another issue doesn't preserve the previous Sprint selected
